message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We combined satellite imagery data from the Global Precipitation Measurement (GPM) mission and field observations on the incidence of droughts to identify drought-prone areas in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Precipitation Measurement (GPM)"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we used the results from the Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) to show the association between women's education level and child nutrition status in Bangladesh.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey (DHS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis combines household survey data from the Afghan Living Conditions Survey (ALCS) and the Afghanistan Urban Household Energy Consumption Survey (AUHECS) to provide new estimates of energy poverty in urban and rural areas of Afghanistan.", "dataset": ["Afghan Living Conditions Survey (ALCS)", "Afghanistan Urban Household Energy Consumption Survey (AUHECS)"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using geospatial data on proximity to forest reserves and data from the Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS), we investigate the impact of forest degradation on household income in rural Ghana.", "dataset": ["Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS)"], "topic": ["Environment", "Income"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of satellite remote sensing data and climate model simulations to quantify the contribution of anthropogenic emissions to precipitation changes in the Amazon basin.", "dataset": ["satellite remote sensing data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "By combining high-resolution satellite images of land use with field data collected from smallholder farmers in Burkina Faso, we evaluate the impact of land-use change on soil quality and agricultural productivity.", "dataset": ["high-resolution satellite images"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We compare data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and Doing Business Indicators to evaluate the business environment in East Asia and the Pacific region.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business Indicators"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of survey and administrative data, we examine the impact of health insurance on early childhood development outcomes in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["health insurance", "survey and administrative data"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We use a mixture of administrative and survey data to study the impact of fiscal decentralization on fiscal discipline and service delivery by subnational governments in Mexico.", "dataset": ["administrative and survey data"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis combines data from several sources including The World Bank's Health Nutrition and Population Statistics database, Service Delivery Indicator (SDI) surveys, and Demographic and Health Survey (DHS) data to provide a comprehensive overview of the state of maternal and child healthcare in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["The World Bank's Health Nutrition and Population Statistics database", "Service Delivery Indicator (SDI) surveys", "Demographic and Health Survey (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}]
